positive_examples: This is an example of return oriented programming attack.
The return oriented programming attack demonstrated clear characteristics.
We observed return oriented programming attack in this context.
A typical case of return oriented programming attack would involve these features.
The concept of return oriented programming attack applies here.
An attack technique that chains together existing code snippets ending in return instructions to execute malicious payloads.
negative_examples: This is an example of buffer overflow attack, not return oriented programming attack.
This represents memory corruption attack in general.
The document was filed in the cabinet.
She walked to the store to buy groceries.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: BufferOverflowAttack, or other types of MemoryCorruptionAttack

definition: A code-reuse attack that chains existing code snippets to execute malicious operations.
